net.co.java.entity

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.co.java.entity.Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Spawnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Monster, Player

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
implements Spawnable
    Abstract class for entities (eg. Monsters and Players)
    Author:
    Thomas Gmelig Meyling, Jan-Willem Gmelig Meyling

    • Method Detail

      • spawn

        public void spawn()
        This method is called to setup the initial spawn. It adds the Entity to a new Map and sends the Spawn packet to the surrounding Players.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(Location location,
               IncomingPacket ip)
        Parameters:
        location -

      • walk

        public void walk(int direction,
        IncomingPacket entityMove)
        The walk method is called when an Entity moves. This can be called from AI (monsters/NPCs) or an Entity Move packet from the client. When existing, the packet can be forwarded. Otherwise, it needs to be created runtime. When the Entity moves, old surroundings should receive an entity remove packet. New surroundings should receive an entity spawn packet. The intersection of surroundings should receive the delegated entity move packet.
